issues.title: RAR type as container of native_callback_uri
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
- Seems cleaner than structured scope
- Simpler to get WG consent for a RAR type than a new top-level OAuth parameter
- Should native_callback_uri equal the client's redirect_uri? NO - as this validation works ONLY for the 1st AS in the originating trust domain

```
Proposed structure:
{
   "type": "https://scheme.example.org/native_callback_uri",
   "locations": [
      "https://app.example.com/native_callback_uri"
   ]
}
```

issues.title: Consider adding new native_authorization_endpoint and corresponding AS metadata
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
A new endpoint and corresponding authorization server metadata.
Note - AS may reuse existing authorization_endpoint instead of creating separate one, or add a path / query parameter to their existing one.
By providing native_authorization_endpoint, AS commits to:
- Supporting the RAR type
- Forwarding the RAR type
- Redirecting with 30x and not JS / HTTP Form Post
- Does not throw captcha if called without cookies

- If downgrade happened because no app claimed the url - retry policy

issues.title: Routing app in the middle
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
- Will be invoked
- Can route forward, but Client App will reject the url as not in allowList
- Solution is that native_authorization_endpoint shall return a JSON response indicating HTTP or native call

If AS offers an app which MAY be invoked for routing:
- It needs to first offer a routing options response
- Based on end-user's response decide if app should be invoked (as final AS), or skip to next hop
